title: Neoteny
summary: Neoteny (/niˈɒtəni/),[1][2][3][4] also called juvenilization,[5] is the delaying or slowing of the physiological (or somatic) development of an organism, typically an animal. Neoteny is found in modern humans (compared to other primates).[6] In progenesis (also called paedogenesis), sexual development is accelerated.[7]
